children.subject:
Hi! I took a gap semester for similar reasons -- feel free to talk on FB or email me at swjin@berkeley.edu.

A friend I know is also doing a conservation summer program with the National Park service this summer -- I'm not sure what the exact link was but this might be a good place to start.

history.content: <md>I've been extremely stressed lately. This semester, I'm finishing my technical requirements (as a CS major). I'm in my third year but I'm planning on staying for a fourth since there's still a lot of interesting classes I want to take. However every semester I have trouble finding the balance between classes and the other parts of my life. It's been a cycle every semester where I feel overwhelmed in the middle of the semester and lose interest in my classes. I'm trying to think of ways to prevent this next semester by balancing school with fun activities. My ideas include taking a gap semester or working a fun part time job while attending school part time. I really enjoy the outdoors so I'm thinking about possibly taking on some type of park ranger job while doing school part time next semester. I would appreciate if anyone has advice or any programs they can refer me to (I have a car so I would be able to commute)! Also if anyone's in the same boat and would like to discuss ideas or opportunities feel free to drop your email.</md>
history.subject: Alternatives to School
